name: His Chuunibyou Cannot Be Cured!
description: Jun Mizushima, is ordinary in every way, except for the fact that he’s the only son of a wealthy businessman and that dabbles in video game development in his spare time. He also has an ability to make everything he wishes a reality. Or, so he thinks.

name: Avernum 3: Ruined World
description: Epic, indie fantasy role-playing adventure with many hours of gameplay. Explore an enormous world that evolves as time passes. Towns are destroyed. Refugees flee. Disasters happen. Features an intricate battle system with multitudes of abilities, character traits, and unique magical artifacts.

name: BattleCore Arena
description: BattleCore Arena is a free to play competitive platform shooter where gravity mastery is the key to victory. Use your trusted weapons and abilities to eject your opponents out of the arena in style. Glory awaits you, take the plunge!

name: You Doesn't Exist
description:
Set out on an adventure that challenges all the codes of the RPG genre, toying with its boundaries to create something unlike anything you've ever seen.
In a world full of magic and adventure, a young boy starts his apprenticeship to become a knight...

name: Bronze Age
description: Two small classics from Clarus Victoria published in 2013, Stone Age and Bronze Age, are now available on Steam! Manage an ancient tribe in the African Savannah, build the first city in the Fertile Crescent, guide your people across prehistory and lead them to Victory!

name: Transport Defender
description: Defend the transport ship from being captured by enemy waves on the way to the jump hole. Upgrade weapons, kill enemies, get cargo, transfer cargo, buy features, repeat.

name: Rover Builder
description: Build amazing 3d vehicles from simple buggies to complex work machinery! In this space themed building game you get to solve increasingly challenging remote-operated missions, as you climb the corporational ladder and unlock new planets.

name: Box Maze 2: Agent Cubert
description:
Jump back into the life of Cubert who after saving his GF from Red has signed up to the S.S.B (Secret Services of Boxes). 
Your first mission as Agent Cubert is to save the daughter of Gaston. 
 
Make your way through 100 new exciting levels while avoiding dangerous hazards and new enemies. Your goal is to progress through the games levels which get harder as you go along, collect pizzas, sweets and jellies to increase your score.

name: Robots: create AI
description: Robots: create AI is a puzzle programming game.

name: Stick Fight: The Game
description: Stick Fight is a physics-based couch/online fighting game where you battle it out as the iconic stick figures from the golden age of the internet

name: Mazeglaser
description: Mazeglaser is a 2d room-based platformer. Evade ghosts, jump above lava-pits, climb ropes to reach the end of the level. Collect coins, extra lives and keys to open barriers. You can find secret rooms or even a secret level.

name: Field of Glory II
description: Field of Glory II is a turn-based tactical game set during the Rise of Rome from 280 BC to 25 BC. It allows you to fight large or small battles for or against Rome, or between the other nations who are as yet unaware of the Roman threat, or what-if battles between nations that never came into conflict historically.

name: Eternal Maze
description: Find the map, find the monoliths, avoid the dogs and survive to escape from the mazes! Inspired by crop circles, Eternal Maze is a puzzle adventure game about a farmer who is trapped in corn mazes.

name: Hand of the Gods
description: Command the Gods, strategically position your forces, and unleash divine powers to defeat your foes in the new turn-based strategy CCG from the makers of SMITE and Paladins!

name: Odysseus Kosmos and his Robot Quest
description: A classic COMEDY QUEST about being geeky and procrastinative in SPACE!

name: Arms of Telos
description: Arms of Telos is a new kind of competitive first person shooter with 30ft tall spider-mechs, zero gravity with full six degrees of freedom, grapple hooks, racing, a fresh new take on capture the flag, and a diverse set of weapons and equipment that challenge long-standing genre archetypes.

name: Caligo
description: Caligo is the darkness everyone descends into one way or another, and to each of us it's something different. For some it's a short but exciting adventure, some will see it as a place to relax. Yet others will be reminded of their worst nightmare, while for a few, it might come as a revelation.

name: Super Perspective
description: A mind-bending puzzle platformer where you can switch between 2D and 3D at will!

name: Accel World vs. Sword Art Online: Deluxe Edition
description:
Svart Alfheim and the Accelerated World have begun to merge. In the midst of the chaos, Yui has gone missing. Kirito must challenge the Seven Kings of pure color from the Accelerated World to gain access to her location.

In the Americas, a limited time digital deluxe launch edition of the game will also be available. It will include two exclusive downloadable content packs.

Ordinal Scale Pack:
- Yuna - Playable Character
- Ordinal Scale Costumes

SAO Origins Pack:
- Sachi - Playable Character
- GGO Avatar Costume - Kirito and Sinon
- Knight of the Blood Oath Costume
- Fairy Dance Avatar Costume - Kirito

name: Dramatic Dungeon: Sakura Taisen - Kimi Arugatame
description: A dungeon crawler RPG where all of the Sakura Wars characters team up.

name: Sakura Taisen GB2
description: The 2nd Game Boy Color Sakura Taisen game.

name: Total Miner: Forge
description: Play Total Miner: Forge and enter a world of creation, construction, exploration, adventure and survival. Play online with up to 23 other friends. Play as one of 30+ different avatars. Over 50 NPC's for RPG worlds. Explore monstrous cave systems, find treasures and battle enemies. Build epic creations with your friends online. How high will your server rate? Browse 1000s of Total Miner worlds.

name: Reincarnations: Awakening
description: Reincarnations: Awakening is a hidden object game for the PC.

name: Star Wolves 3: Ashes of Victory
description: Ashes of Victory is upcoming stand-alone expansion to Star Wolves 3.

name: Nora to Toki no Koubou: Kiri no Mori no Majo
description:
"The island in the lake, a forest inhabited by witch Vera's mist" is a legend in the town of Tenperina.

Noora Brandor is a time-bender. By the law of her family, for three years in a foreign land, she must train to be a master time-bender. However, Noora is mistaken for the witch Vera by some villagers from the town of Tenperina. She must prove her innocence to the villagers by completing certain tasks.

name: All Kamen Rider: Rider Generation
description: All Kamen Rider: Rider Generation is a 2D Beat 'Em Up sidescoller published by Bandai Namco for the Nintendo DS. It was released on August 4, 2011. It was followed by a sequel the next year, All Kamen Rider: Rider Generation 2‏‎.

name: Amazon Trail II
description:
Amazon Trail II is an educational game and the sequel to The Amazon Trail. In this game you have to canoe up the Amazon River. Before starting, it is obligatory to choose yourself a guide - each of the four available candidates has a special skill that may help you on your journey. In the course of the game, you need to manage the supplies; meet, talk, and trade with different people presented by live actors in FMV; read maps; and decide how much to eat, when to rest, and how fast to paddle.

The game also contains a huge amount of information about the science and history of the Amazon rainforest. It is possible to explore the rainforest along the route spotting one of 100 different species and taking pictures or picking up fruits for the supply. There is a fishing mini-game as well, and six more learning games where kids learn the origins of commodities like coffee, rice, and chocolate, locate the major rivers of the world etc.

name: EverQuest: Veil of Alaris
description: Veil of Alaris is the eighteenth expansion to the original EverQuest.

name: Captain America: Shield of Justice
description: 16-bit platformer featuring Captain America.

name: Army of Darkness Defense
description: In this tug-of-war, casual defense game based on the MGM classic movie, you play Ash, the time-traveling, evil-fighting, S-Mart sales clerk as you defend Lord Arthur’s castle and the Necronomicon from the oncoming hordes of evil undead. Of course, you can’t do it alone! Call upon multitudes of allies including Lord Arthur, Duke Henry the Red, the Wiseman, and many more to help you in your quest to defend the unholy book and use it to return to your own time. Army Of Darkness: Defense takes the witty charm of the cult classic movie and combines it with gorgeous graphics and innovative casual gameplay that is certain to entertain any mobile gamer. Features include: Bruce Campbell as Ash Williams, 50 initial waves and an unlockable endless wave, more than 100 hilarious quotes from the movie, originally composed music score, special abilities including the boomstick, the chainsaw, the ’88 deathcoaster and many more spells, all of your favorite characters including Arthur, Henry, Sheila, the Wiseman and Evil Ash.

name: Boulder Dash-XL
description: HD remake of the Boulder Dash series featuring hundreds of new maps and new types of game modes.

name: The Lost Angelic Chronicles of Frane: Dragon's Odyssey
description: The 3rd Frane action RPG game from Exe-Create, also known as "Lost Memory of Angel Frane"

name: Defender Chronicles: Legend of the Desert King
description: Defender Chronicles is a side-view tower defense with RPG elements. Gameplay progresses in part by equipping your general, and slowly unlocks a story.

name: Vampire Brides: Love Over Death
description: A dark and intriguing hidden object game where Catalina seeks to help her ill father.

name: Metal Max 2: Reloaded
description: Metal Max 2: Reloaded is the official name of the Nintendo DS remake ion Metal Max 2, it was developed by Cattle Call and published by Kadokawa Games.

name: Draw Race 2: Racing Evolved
description: An iOS racing game that utilizes touch-based controls to maneuver through 3D environments.

name: Beach Paddle
description: An Xbox 360 indie game. Can you be the Beach Paddle champion?

name: Oddworld: Squeek's Oddysee
description: Oddworld: Squeek's Oddysee is a canceled title in the classic Oddworld series. It was meant to be the third major installment in the classic Quintology, introducing Squeek as a third main character alongside Abe and Munch. After the problematic release of Oddworld: Stranger's Wrath, Oddworld Inhabitants closed its doors for several years and the project was shelved indefinitely.

name: Hacker Evolution 2010
description: A portable entry in the Hacker Evolution series, trading the console-command-heavy style of the previous games for a faster, phone-friendly puzzle system.

name: The Clumsys 2: Butterfly Effect
description: The Clumsys 2: Butterfly Effect is a hidden object/puzzle game for the PC.

name: Shin Megami Tensei: Devil Children - Hi no Shou
description: A Japan only Game Boy Advance game in the Shin Megami Tensei Devil Children series. Along with Ice Book it's the sequel to Book of Light/Book of Dark in the SMT series.

name: Armageddon Man
description: Sin descripción

name: Platformance: Temple Death
description: The sequel to Platformance: Castle Pain. An Xbox Live Indie release, the game is a platformer set in one huge level.

name: Street Cleaning Simulator
description: Street Cleaning Simulator is a PC game. It accurately depicts the riveting day to day life of a street cleaner.

name: Big Town Shootout
description: A four-player cowboy-themed WiiWare shooter.

name: The Angry Hand of God
description: The Angry Hand Of God is an Xbox Live Indie game, in which you, as God cause mass destruction to civilizations with lightning bolts.

name: Hearts Spades Euchre
description: This DSiWare game nets you the classic card games Hearts, Spades and Euchre for 500 DSi Points.

name: Boardwalk Ball Toss
description: Throw baseballs at bottles in this DSiWare title.

name: The Lost Town: The Dust
description: Get dusted with this DSiWare release from CIRCLE Entertainment.

name: Exoplanet War
description: Exoplanet War is a totally free, browser-based MMORTS game which doesn't require any downloads in order to enjoy the game, as a result you can play the game. anywhere anytime with thousands of real players.

name: James Pond in the Deathly Shallows
description: James Pond makes his return in this iPhone game.

name: Marksman: Long Range
description: An Xbox indie game that focuses on realistic target rifle shooting. It was released as an XBLA Indie title on March 10th 2011

name: Chronicles of Inotia: Legend of Feanor
description: This mobile action-RPG was developed by Korean developer Com2US.

name: Inotia 2: A Wanderer of Luone
description: The sequel to the mobile action-RPG, Chronicles of Inotia.

name: Tower Defense: Lost Earth
description: This Korean developed mobile tower defense game is the only tower defense game that can be named "Tower Defense" since its developer owns the trademark to the term.

name: Twisted: A Haunted Carol
description: A HOG developed by Casual Arts Twisted takes the classic Christmas tale and adds a new slant to it. You take the role of Jacob Marley and you begin the game just as you are murdered.

name: Chocolate Tycoon
description: Chocolate Tycoon is a mobile time management and business sim by Korean developer Com2US.

name: From Out of a Dark Night Sky
description: From Out of a Dark Night Sky is a text based adventure game for the ZX Spectrum.

name: Pocket Academy
description: Manage and build your own academy, from the makers of Game Dev Story.

name: Pop Idol: The Official Video Game
description:
American Idol is a rhythm game based on the reality TV singing competition of the same name.

Players can create characters of either gender, choosing from several character templates, and then customizing them with body size, skin color, and one of three singing voices per gender.

Created characters can then be taken through the game's various modes. In the main Competition mode, players move through different stages patterned after the TV series, from auditions to shows with a live audience and hopefully the finals. Between performances, outfit, hair style and color and make up can be customized, since not only the singing but also the style will be judged.

name: The Sword of Camelot
description: In The Sword of Camelot you will find a variety of mini-games targeted for young children. Though, the game also has the peculiarity of having more of a cinematic feel, rather than playable portions.

name: Tweenies - Game Time
description: Tweenies: Game Time is the first video game based on the popular kids TV series Tweenies. This game catches the beliefs of young kids with its choice of participating activities. Led by Milo, Jake, Fizz and Bella, young players get to discover the identical impression of fun and associating as in a brilliant BBC TV series.

name: Daisu-Kiss
description: Daisu-Kiss is a party video game developed and published by Konami.

name: Scream Machines
description: Scream Machines allows you to build your own track layouts, and then go for a virtual ride.

name: 1-Bit Ninja
description: A deliberate copy of the level design and graphical style of Super Mario Land for the Game Boy, with the added twist of being able to tilt the camera in 3D space to look for hidden pathways your ninja can take.

name: Pro Jumper! Guilty Gear Tangent!?
description: A side scrolling DSiWare platformer.

name: Madness Accelerant
description: Created By Mindchamber and Tom Fulp of newgrounds.com Madness Accelerant was a creative play by play reenactment of the Madness Consternation episode created by Matt 'Krinkles' Jolly

name: I Spy Riddle Race
description: I Spy Riddle Race is a hidden picture game based on the Scholastic I Spy books.

name: Ougon Musou Kyoku X
description: Xbox 360 port of Golden Fantasia (黄金夢想曲 Ougon Musou Kyoku).

name: Drive a Steam Train
description: Train simulator from 2011. Available on Steam.

name: James Bond: Q's Shooting Range
description: A light gun game, where you train to be MI6s best agent.

name: Sengoku Basara Chronicle Heroes
description:
Sengoku BASARA Chronicle Heroes is a PlayStation Portable game released by Capcom on July 14, 2011.

The game is similar to the previous PSP release Sengoku Basara: Battle Heroes. Gamers create a team consisting of two heroes from the series and face off in battle against another player. The game will support up to four players ad hoc. This game feature characters from Sengoku Basara: Samurai Heroes (called Sengoku Basara 3 in Japan) like Ishida Mitsunari and the revamped Tokugawa Ieyasu. Token Sengoku Basara characters Date Masamune and Sanada Yukimura return as playable characters.

New stages include a different take on a section in Sekigahara from Sengoku BASARA: Samurai Heroes. The PSP version will have height differences, which means that battles will also be taken above ground. Speaking of which, the game will now feature new aerial combat elements due to fan request. Characters can now pull off combos while in mid-jump.

name: Super Sentai Battle: Ranger Cross
description: Super Sentai Battle: Ranger Cross is a video game developed by Paon and published by Bandai Namco Games Inc. in September of 2011, as part of the 35th anniversary celebration of Super Sentai. The game follows a musou-style formula in which you are pitted against hordes of enemies on a playing field and must defeat all enemies to advance, with battles in the mechas interspersed here and there. This game is technically a Gokaiger game, but as they are not the only ones you can play as, this is why the game is called Super Sentai Battle and not Kaizoku Sentai Gokaiger. The teams you can play as are: Kaizoku Sentai Gokaiger (2011) Samurai Sentai Shinkenger (2009) Tensou Sentai Goseiger (2010) Engine Sentai Go-Onger (2008) Himitsu Sentai Goranger (1975-1976) This would be the first time a non-Heisei era team would be playable in any Super Sentai game that was not a crossover with other franchises, as Goranger was the first season of Super Sentai. The other teams up to Go-Onger make appearances through the Gokai keys, but they are an extension of the Gokaiger team, and therefore are not truly playable.

name: Shin Koihime Musou: Otome Ryouran Sangokushi Engi
description: The "True" Koihime Musou reimagines the events of the original with enhanced gameplay, new characters, new art, new plot, and multiple campaigns.

name: Star Trek: Infinite Space
description:
Star Trek: Infinite Space is cancelled free-to-play browser-based MMO developed by keen games and published by Gameforge.

Players would have been able to play as members of either the United Federation of Planets or the Klingon Empire during the Dominion War as depicted in the TV show Star Trek: Deep Space Nine.

name: A Collection of Intellivision Classic Games
description:
30 Activision game from the Intellivision. It is a follow-up to A Collection of Activision Classic Games for the 2600.
This collections has 30 of the Mattel Electronics machine's most popular games, each is emulated to play exactly as it did nearly two decades before. You also have the ability to save at any time during a game, and the compilation includes interviews with original developers of Intellivision titles.

name: Rebuild of Evangelion: Sound Impact
description: Evangelion Shin Gekijouban: 3nd Impact (ヱヴァンゲリヲン新劇場版 –サウンドインパクト-3nd Impact) is a Rhythm video game published by Bandai Namco Games released on September 29th, 2011 for the PlayStation Portable.

name: Gundam Tri Age
description: Gundam Tri Age is an arcade card battle game. It is named after Mobile Suit Gundam AGE, but also features characters from the 00, 0079, and Unicorn series.

name: Umineko no Naku Koro ni Chiru: Episode 8 - Twilight of the Golden Witch
description:
Twilight of the Golden Witch is the eighth arc of the Umineko no Naku Koro ni series as well as the fourth and final arc of Umineko no Naku Koro ni Chiru. The story follows Ange Ushiromiya as she is pulled between the whims of two Game Masters: Battler and Bernkastel.

The original release of Twilight of the Golden Witch contains the previous 3 episodes. In other words, it is effectively the full Chiru release.

name: Ore no Shikabane wo Koete Yuke
description: Ore no Shikabane wo Koete Yuke (roughly, "over my dead body,") is a dungeon crawler RPG where the player controls a clan of warriors, cursed to die young, over several generations as they try to defeat the demon that cursed them. Aside from combat, the player must also manage the clans resources, and ensure a new generation is ready to take over when the curse kills their parents. Set in ancient Japan, the game is heavily influenced by traditional Japanese art and mythology.

name: Super Tofu Boy
description: A parody of Super Meat Boy / propaganda title made by the animal rights organization PETA. Save Bandage Girl from Meat Boy's bloody, jealous rage!

name: Six-Gun Shootout: Gunfights of the Wild West
description: Turn-based strategy featuring wild west gunfighters. Created by SSI (Strategic Simulations Inc)

name: Grand Prix Story
description:
Build the town of your dreams with all sorts of shops, landmarks and houses!
Tired of tedious town simulators taking up your time? Develop dream dwellings down to the last brick and construct cityscapes crawling as far as the eye can see in this stimulating simulation game!

name: Red Bull X-Fighters World Tour
description: A downloadable freestlye motocross game from Konami that promises high speed and big jumps.

name: Fruit Ninja Kinect
description: An arcade style game where the player must chop fruit with their hands and feet while avoiding bombs. A Kinect-required XBLA version of the original iOS release.

name: Fighting For One Piece
description: Fighting For One Piece is a fighting game for the Playstation 2 console inspired by the successful One Piece anime. The game is different from many other One Piece games which used chibi versions of the characters, like One Piece Grand Adventure, instead the characters are modelled after their anime counterparts. It was released on September 6, 2005.

name: Crazy Streets - Thrill Drive 4
description: An arcade racing game, where you race through traffic. You get a score based on how much damage your accidents cause.

name: Thrill Drive 3
description: An arcade racing game, where you race through traffic. You get a score based on how much damage your accidents cause.

name: Thrill Drive 2
description: An arcade racing game, where you race through traffic. You get a score based on how much damage your accidents cause.

name: Thrill Drive
description: An arcade racing game, where you race through traffic. You get a score based on how much damage your accidents cause.

name: Generation Girl Gotta Groove
description:
A dancing game featuring the Generation Girl line of Barbie dolls.

Generation Girl Gotta Groove is a creativity game that offers Barbie fans the opportunity to choose a character (Barbie, Marissa, Nichelle, Susie, Chelsie or Marie), dress her up, choose music and perform her own dances. Girls can train, print cards, and record up to 9 dance sessions. The program can also import pictures from the Barbie Photo Designer digital camera.

name: Alan Probe: Amateur Surgeon - Christmas Edition
description: An Amateur Surgeon game with some extra features.

name: Mystery Quest: Curse of the Ancient Spirits
description: Travel to the Caribbean! Solve the mystery of Christopher Columbus' untouched treasure!

name: Sissy's Magical Ponycorn Adventure
description: A point-and-click adventure game developed by Ryan Henson Creighton (age 33) with art, voice, and music by Cassie Creighton (age 5).

name: The Adventures of Felix Fox: Tale of the Night
description: The Adventures of Felix Fox: Tale of the Night is an indie game on Xbox Live Arcade. It costs one dollar.

name: Ace Driver: Victory Lap
description: Ace Driver Victory Lap is a sequel of is a 3D racing arcade game released by Namco in 1995, featuring more tracks and Formula One cars (which all, again, carry advertisements for older Namco games) than its predecessor, as well as a new championship mode, all in a modern futuristic setting.

name: Lady Gaga: Born This Way Revenge
description: Lady Gaga's new album, Born This Way, is presented here for your tapping pleasure. It also includes a bunch of bonus tracks from the special edition.

name: Hydro Thunder Go
description: Hydro Thunder Go is a remake of the original game.

name: Babylonian Twins
description: A 2D puzzle platformer in the Lost Vikings vein for mobile platforms.

name: Black Jack: Hi no Tori Hen
description:
Black Jack: Hi no Tori Hen is very much a Elite Beat Agents-style game, having to tap or drag your stylus across the screen at the right speed and accuracy, as well as a comic to read in the background of the game to be used a storyline for each patient, some have an effect of what happens during surgery causing distractions or harder accuracy.

For most of the game, Black Jack is just simply performing surgeries for Tezuka's Star System characters, some of which are based on chapters from the Manga series. Though the game has its own main plot as the game progresses.

name: Daredevil: The Man Without Fear
description: A beat 'em up based on the Marvel hero Daredevil. It was cancelled not long before its slated release.

name: OvenBreak Infinity
description: Jump, Slide, and Swing with Ginger Brave in his mad dash for freedom!

name: The Ultimate Alphabet
description: A photo hunt in reverse, you tell the game what you see in each image composed of hundreds of objects and topics that all start with the same letter.

name: Social City
description: The original city builder on the social networking website Facebook.

name: Sorority Life
description: Sorority simulation game on the social networking sites MySpace and Facebook.

name: Mobsters 2: Vendetta
description: Sequel to the popular Playdom game Mobsters.

name: Wild Ones
description: Turn based PVP game for the social networking side Facebook.

name: Gardens of Time
description: Gardens of Time is a hidden objects and building simulator game for Web Browsers on Facebook and on iOS. The player is part of a secret society that has unlocked the power of time travel. Something has gone awry in the space-time continuum, and the duty to unravel the mystery is placed upon the player. Use your Time Machine to travel through time visiting more than a thousand scenes.

name: City of Wonder
description: City-building game on social networking websites such as Facebook and Google+.

name: Senritsu no Stratus
description: An action adventure game from the creators of Infinite Space.

name: Market Street
description: Retail based sim game on the social networking site Facebook.

name: Endless Midnight: Zombie Swarm
description: Blast your way through a horde of zombies with a top-notch arsenal! Compete for high scores and gain a variety of medals through challenging game modes.

name: Civil Disturbance
description: A PC first-person shooter set in a future America where an oppressed populace rebels against the government.

name: Mario Paint BS Ban
description:
Mario Paint BS Ban is a version of Mario Paint which had joypad support. For this release of the game, a Mario Paint contest was held, in which contestants of exceptional Mario Paint artistic skill made artwork pieces.

Mario Paint BS Ban - Yuushou Sakuhin Naizou Version (「マリオペイントＢＳ版 (優勝作品内蔵バージョン)」) was a second downloadable version for the Satellaview that ran between December 28, 1997 and January 31, 1998. It is a modified version of the original Mario Paint BS Ban that includes the winning design from the associated "Mario Paint Contest". The winning picture was designed by a Tokyo-based gamer named Hiroko Mizota (溝田 祐子), and it is entitled "Dreaming of the Moon."

name: Perished: The Zurkez Project
description:
A short game made using Torque 3D Beta, with content packs.
Created by a kid with crayon cutscenes.

name: Shingata Medarot Kabuto/Kuwagata
description: Shingata Medarot is a remake of the first Medarot and was the last game in the series until its DS entry years later. Its art style is a huge departure from its predecessors'.

name: Seiya Monogatari: Anearth Fantasy Stories
description: The first installment of an ambitious yet unfinished trilogy of JRPGs for the PC Engine-CD.

name: Pucca Noodle Rush
description: Similar to other diner dash games, controlling, running and time-managing a noodle restaurant with the loveable Pucca. Customers are catered to and the restaurant is customizable.

name: Pucca's Kisses
description:
Pucca has one great dream in her life, to kiss her sweet and tender Garu, the little Ninja, who does not have the slightest desire in the world to do so!
By using the Wiimote, you embark on small adventures to overcome obstacles to kiss Garu, your true love!

name: SD Gundam G Generation Neo
description: Sin descripción

name: SD Gundam G Generation Seed
description: Sin descripción

name: Pucca Power Up
description: A Nintendo DS title based on the popular Pucca franchise and TV show, originating from the cute simple Flash web animations many years ago. Now grown it popularity, Pucca - who is on a never-ending quest to show her affection to her ninja boyfriend, Garu - sets off on more adventures in this platforming collection of 6 chapters consisting of mini games.

name: Face Kart: Photo Finish
description: A tilt-controlled racer from Renegade Kid and Majesco

name: Imaginary Range
description: A half game, half comic book hybrid, developed by h.a.n.d. inc and published by Square Enix for iOS devices.

name: The Berenstain Bears: Big Number Hunt
description: A Berenstain Bears Atari VCS Voice Module game. Teaches about numbers.

name: Smurfs Save the Day: Greedy Smurf
description: A Smurfs game for the Atari VCS Voice Module. Teaches about colors.

name: Smurfs Save the Day: Harmony Smurf
description: A Smurfs game for the Atari VCS Voice Module. Teaches about music.

name: Smurfs Save the Day: Handy Smurf
description: A Smurfs game for the Atari VCS Voice Module. Teaches about shapes.

name: Pinky and the Brain: World Conquest
description: Pinky and the Brain: World Conquest is a puzzle/maze game for the PC.

name: Chuugaku Hisshuu Ei Bunpou: Chuugaku 2 Nensei You
description: An educational game for the Sega SG-1000. Teaches about football, the Statue of Liberty, and other locations.

name: Chuugaku Hisshuu Ei Bunpou: Chuugaku 1 Nensei You
description: An educational game released in 1983. Teaches about the USA.

name: Ultraman Powered: Kaijuu Gekimetsu Sakusen
description: Ultraman Powered: Kaijū Destruction Tactics is a CD-ROM-based action adventure game for the Playdia console.

name: Aqua Adventure: Blue Lilty
description: An adventure game for the Playdia.

name: SD Gundam Daizukan
description: SD Gundam Daizukan (SDガンダム 大図鑑) is a CD-ROM-based adventure game for the Playdia console. The title roughly translates to "SD Gundam Big Visual Guide" and is sometimes also identified by the label "SD Gundam 10 Years Memory 1985-1994".

name: Kinnikuman: Muscle Generations
description: Kinnikuman: Muscle Generations is a Wrestling video game published by Bandai released on February 23rd, 2006 for the PlayStation Portable.

name: Kinnikuman Muscle Grand Prix Max 2: Tokumori
description: Sin descripción

name: Dream Chronicles: The Book of Fire
description: A cancelled Dream Chronicles game.

name: Dream Chronicles: The Book of Water
description: The fifth game in the Dream Chronicles series.

name: Robot Unicorn Attack: Heavy Metal
description: A sequel to the popular Robot Unicorn Attack.

name: Zuma Blitz

Through the centuries, Euforia developed many customs based on the use of Will, but when one day they realized that their civilization would soon come to an end, they poured all their Will into crystals in order to leave a record of their culture behind. After this, Euforia sank to the bottom of the ocean.

In the present day, with the ocean now taking up over half of the world, the seas became populated with many pirates. Those pirates, hearing the legend of the crystals, began to search the ocean for clues to their whereabouts.

Among those pirates was one young boy dreaming of greatness.

The game is a spin-off within the Ogre Battle series, originally created by Quest Corporation. The storyline takes place parallel to "Ogre Battle: The March of the Black Queen", and follows the path of Prince Tristan of Zenobia during his quest to reclaim his kingdom. As with other Ogre Battle titles, the player controls squads of an army, moving to different parts of the map accomplishing tasks and battling armies encountered on the route. Choices made during the narrative impact the ending.

Time Cruise is a pinball game from FACE with a sci-fi theme and multiple tables. Unlike most pinball games with extended play zones, these tables are to the left and right of the core table, and the pinball can switch between them by passing through connecting tunnels. In addition, the player can power up time machines by hitting several levers with the pinball. Entering a time machine takes the pinball to a number of different time zones, each providing a possible score boost or extra ball.

name: Bobby Carrot 3: Evolution
description:
The one game to take to a desert island.
Grab your swimming trunks and prepare yourself for adventures with the super-bunny, Bobby Carrot. In this arcade-style puzzle game Bobby will not only challenge your strategic skills but also get his feet wet!
Already a smash hit in Europe with a huge cult following, for the first time Bobby Carrot is now coming to the US and chances are, he will also come to a cell phone near you!
With 65 levels of challenging gameplay, "Bobby Carrot 3: Evolution" is a brain-teaser that offers fun for all ages.
Bobby Carrot 3: Evolution" has been showered with awards already and since the game contains no violence it is suitable for the entire family!
Following Bobby the super-bunny, the player has to collect all the energy stars on each level before advancing to the next level. This is becoming increasingly tricky, however, as traps and blockers get in Bobby's way, making for a challenging gaming experience.

This is the sequel to Queen's Blade: Spiral Chaos.
It features returning game exclusive characters Jean and Cute, and introduces a new heroine, Maron Makaron.
It also features characters from other forms of media, such as the Soul Calibur, Tekken, Dead or Alive, Samurai Showdown, BlazBlue, Guilty Gear, and the King of Fighters fighting game series, as well as other anime and manga series.

name: Kowloon's Gate

description: The most recent title in the role-playing series from Artdink, released for PlayStation 2.

name: Lunatic Dawn Odyssey
description:
Lunatic Dawn Odyssey is a RPG in which the player controls a group of adventures that begina quest, they will go through different towns and other places. In their journeys they will face different kind of enemies and could talk to different characters and they can change their equipment in the shops.

The game uses a first person perspective in the adventure part and a third person perspective in the battle part. The battle part is the classic turn based rpg style. The game features a high degree of freedom since the character can get married and have children and each time that the game is played the circunstances can changed so there are a lot of different endings.

name: Lunatic Dawn III
description: The third title in the Lunatic Dawn series from Artdink, released for PlayStation.

name: Lunatic Dawn FX
description:
A role-playing game in the Lunatic Dawn series from Artdink, released for PC-FX in 1995.

In spite of its Japanese origin, Lunatic Dawn is in fact much more similar to very old-school Western RPGs than to its Japanese brethren. It has virtually no story and relies entirely on exploration and strategic combat. Set in a medieval world with little to no distinguishing characteristics, "Lunatic Dawn" throws the player immediately into the game world, which is open for him to explore. The player is able to choose the main character's gender, race (human, elf, etc.), class, and even age - older characters are more powerful, but have a more limited play time.

Indeed, the entire gameplay process is timed. Traveling to a remote city or dungeon can take up to several game days. The player has to provide sufficient food for his party during this time. Player party consists of pre-generated characters, who have different names and belong to different races and classes, but have virtually no personality. Food and other supplies can be acquired in towns, through which the player moves in a Wizardry-like fashion - viewing locations from first-person perspective and selecting menu commands.

When the party enters a dungeon, the view switches to isometric. The dungeons are large and maze-like, with enemies visible on screen. Upon contact with an enemy, a battle initiates. The battles are turn-based but fast-paced, reminding somewhat the Infinity Engine battles from Baldur's Gate series. The participants can freely move on the battle field. The player directly controls only the main characters, but can assign general commands to the party members.

name: Lunatic Dawn II
description:
The second title in the role-playing series from Artdink, released in 1994 for FM-Towns and PC98.

Like other Lunatic Dawn games, Lunatic Dawn II is, despite its Japanese origins, an exploration-oriented Western-style RPG. There is no main story line in the game, beside the cryptic mentioning of a legendary group of heroes who fought demons and as a result became demons themselves in the introduction sequence. There are no "main goal" in the game, and no plot-advancing events; it is entirely dedicated to free-form exploration and role-playing.

name: Lunatic Dawn
description:
The first title in the Lunatic Dawn series from Artdink, released in 1993 for PC-98 and FM-Towns.

The game is dedicated to character creation, RPG-style character development, and exploration. In the beginning, the player creates the playable character, choosing age, gender, and even weaknesses - all of which affect the character's parameters such as stamina, weapon technique, charisma, etc. Afterwards, the player allocates points into the remaining parameters. The player starts in a city and is absolutely free to go wherever he/she wants. There is a day/night cycle in the game. It is necessary to keep an eye on the character's stamina and buy food rations - the character can die of exhaustion and hunger. Random enemies appear on the world map and in dungeons. Battle screen is isometric and allows free movement. It is not necessary to choose a command for each turn: the battles evolve automatically until the player interrupts them with a new command.

name: Carnage Heart EZ: Easy Zapping
description: A mecha action-strategy game from Artdink.

name: How Many Robots?
description: An action game from Artdink.

name: Zeus: Carnage Heart Second
description: The sequel to Carnage Heart, a mecha action-strategy game from Artdink.

name: Zeus II: Carnage Heart
description: A mecha action strategy game from Artdink.

name: Carnage Heart Portable
description: Carnage Heart Portable is an Action game, developed by Artdink and published by Genki, which was released in Japan in 2006.

name: Super Laser: The Alien Fighter
description: Super Laser recreates the true spirit of the classic shoot'em up games.

name: ChocChocPop
description: ChocChocPop was the first self-published title for EpicForce. With its excellent animation, high quality graphics and addictive game play, ChocChocPop was welcomed by many players around the world.

name: Ore no Imouto ga Konna ni Kawaii wake ga Nai Portable
description:
Ore no Imouto ga Konna ni Kawaii Wake ga Nai Portable is a romantic comedy visual novel developed by guyzware and published by Banpresto.

Unlike the original story of the light novels, Oreimo Portable expands on the story, with complete story routes for Kyousuke and each of the main female casts written by the original creator of the light novels, Tsukasa Fushimi.

name: Hidden Mysteries: Salem Secrets
description: Help Constable Hawthorne investigate the rumors of witchcraft in Hidden Mysteries – Salem Secrets, a fun Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game! Four young girls have been suffering from an outbreak of mysterious fits and bizarre tantrums. Rumors abound that the girls have been "afflicted" by local practitioners of Witchcraft, but nobody has yet been charged or tried. Investigate the scenes and uncover the Hidden Mysteries!

name: Urusei Yatsura: Koi no Survival Party
description: A Urusei Yatsura adventure game.

name: Urusei Yatsura: Miss Tomobiki wo Sagase!
description: A Urusei Yatsura role-playing game for Game Boy.

name: Urusei Yatsura: Stay With You
description: An Urusei Yatsura adventure game for the TurboGrafx CD.

name: Yakyuu Dou: The Way to Gloria
description: Baseball game developed by Nihon Create in 1989.

name: Super Yakyuudou '93 - 94 Nendo Data Kaiteiban
description: Baseball game developed by Nihon Create in 1994.

name: Lupin the 3rd: Babylon no Ougon Densetsu
description: A Lupin III adventure game inspired by the same title anime movie

name: Punch the Monkey! Game Edition
description: A rhythm game featuring music from a series of Lupin III remix albums.

name: Lupin Sansei: Columbus no Isan
description: Sin descripción

name: Shuyaku wa Zenigata
description: A Lupin III puzzle game for PS2 and PSP, starring Inspector Zenigata.

name: Lupin the Third: Cagliostro no Shiro
description: A video game adaption of Hayao Miyazaki's Lupin III anime film of the same name. Released for NEC PC-88, Sharp X1, and FM 7.

name: Pri Pri: Primitive Princess!
description: This is an action puzzle game where you control a caveman climbing a tower. The tower is filled wit monsters and traps. Sometimes, what appears to be a solid piece of flooring as actually a hole, so stepping on it will cause you to fall. Monsters can be defeating by pounding your hammer on the floor tile above them, causing it to fall and crush them. The same process can be used to enter rooms that cannot be accessed any other way. The hammer can also be used to make floor tiles appear in order to cross a gap. However, the hammer has a limited number of uses, so you must be careful to use it correctly. In order to access the next floor, you must collect a crystal, which causes a ladder to appear.

name: SD Lupin Sansei: Kinko Yaburi Daisakusen
description: A Lupin III puzzle game released for Game Boy.

name: Baseball Superstars 2011
description: The sequel to Baseball Superstars 2010 includes enhanced modes, extra customization, and fresh graphics.

name: Super Yakyuudou 2
description: Baseball game developed by Nihon Create in 1994.

name: Susume Choujou Genshou Kenkyuubu!
description: Eroge adventure game developed by Nikukyuu in 1996.

name: Top wo Nerae: Cybernetic High-School III
description: An official strip-quiz game featuring characters from the Gainax OVA. It was actually developed by Gainax itself. It was only released in Japan, in 1990.

name: Civizard: Majutsu no Keifu
description: A strategy game from SimTex, released for Playstation.

name: Lupin Sansei: Shijou Saidai no Zunousen
description:
Lupin the Third embarks in a new adventure to solve the mistery of Paradox.
The game features puzzles that will test your IQ and side scrolling areas where you'll have to sneak through guards and escape from old Zenigata.

name: Lupin III: The Master File
description:
Lupin III: The Master File is a collection of materials related to the production of the Lupin III anime from 1971 to 1994. This includes character sheets, location maps, original sketches, music, poster scans, and plot summaries.

An expanded edition of Master File was released on DVD and Blu-Ray on March 28, 2012.

name: Lupin Sansei: Pyramid no Kenja
description: A 3D action game set in the Lupin III universe.

name: Rami-chan no Ooedo Sugoroku: Keio Yuugeki-tai Gaiden
description:
Rami-chan no Ooedo Sugoroku: Keio Yuugekitai Gaiden is a 1998 video game for the PlayStation. Developed by Victor Interactive Software, it is the third and last game in the Keio Flying Squadron series, and was released only in Japan. While the first game is a side-scrolling shoot 'em up and its sequel, Keio Flying Squadron 2, is a platformer with shooter sections, the third game is a party game.
Like the first two games, the third game refers to Japanese culture, both ancient and modern simultaneously.

name: The Unsolved
description: Sin descripción

name: Lupin the 3rd Chronicles
description: A Lupin III anthology for the Sega Saturn Saturn, containing anime footage from the first two anime series and the first two anime films, as well as character information.

name: VM Japan: Vantage Master - Mystic Far East
description: A hexagonal turn-based tactical RPG set in feudal Japan by Nihon Falcom that supports both single-player and multiplayer.

name: Lumines: Advance Pack
description: More level galore for Lumines

name: Heir of Zendor: The Legend and The Land
description: Sin descripción

name: Saturn Bomberman Fight!!
description: Saturn Bomberman Fight!! is a 1997 maze video game developed and published by Hudson Soft for the Sega Saturn. It is the second Bomberman game for the Saturn, after Saturn Bomberman. It features full 3D graphics unlike previous titles in the series.

name: Super Real Mahjong Pocket
description: An installment in the Super Real Mahjong series for the NGPC.

name: Ore no Yome: Anata Dake no Hanayome
description: Sin descripción

name: The Path of Go
description: A console version of the ancient boardgame of Go, released to Xbox Live Arcade and features gameplay with your avatar.

name: New Roommania: Porori Seishun
description: "New Roommania: Porori Seishun" is a sequel to "Roommania #203." The game features male and female protagonists, with scenarios involving diverse interactions and life changes. This sequel introduces new characters and scenarios while maintaining the core concept of subtle life intervention within the unique setting of various room scenarios.

name: Petz Wild Animals Tigerz
description: Tigerz puts you in the role of animal trainers Enzo and Ana, who are tasked with raising two endangered tiger cubs. Players put on shows and travel the world to save the family company from bankruptcy.

name: Ecco Jr. and The Great Ocean Treasure Hunt!
description: An educational game for the Pico featuring Ecco Jr.

name: Star Trek: Captain's Chair
description: A simulated tour of the bridges of five ships from the show. View the bridges from various angles and interact with their consoles.

name: Socks the Cat Rocks the Hill
description: A canceled SNES game in which you played as Bill Clinton's cat, Socks. Although it was completed, it was not released because of political controversy. It was released later, in 2018, published by Second Dimension.

name: 2601: Teikoku Kidou Butai no Koubou
description: Strategy game developed by Nexus Interact in 1994.

name: Ikenie no Yoru
description: Ikenie no Yoru is a horror, adventure video game for the Nintendo Wii. In the game, the player controls in turn five teenagers exploring a haunted mansion. The player has no weapons against the ghosts, and instead must run away to avoid being touched and killed.

name: Star Wars: Imperial Academy
description: Four player Deathmatch Arena Shooter for the iPhone & iPod Touch from ngmoco

name: Techno Kitten Adventure
description: Control a jetpack-equipped kitten over a rainbow background synced with DJ Hixxy's Sea of Love. Techno Kitten Adventure is an Xbox "Indie Game" for 240 MSP, and is also available on iOS (iPhone, iPod, iPad) for free download.

name: Tom and the Ghost
description: Tom and the Ghost is an classic platformer from 1990.

name: Rolemaster: Magestorm
description: An online-only 3D arena game, based on Iron Crown's "Rolemaster" rule set. Features a fantasy theme with persistent RPG stats.

name: Da Capo II: Plus Communication
description: PC release of the popular visual novel Da Capo II; featuring additional scenes including adult elements.

name: Macross Triangle Frontier
description: Triangle Frontier is the third game in the Macross Frontier-based series of action games. This game features Academy Mode, which allows the player to create a pilot and build their stats.

name: Epic Dungeon
description: An Xbox Live Indie game developed and published by Eyehook. The title was later ported to iOS as "Cursed Loot".

name: Tatsumaki: Land at War
description: Upcoming MMORPG set in feudal Japan.

name: Chakra-kun's Charm Paradise
description: Chakura-kun no Omajinai Paradise is the final game to be released for the Casio Loopy. Based on the manga Magic Cat Chakra-kun, created by Megumi Tachibana. This game contains a number of activities made up of picture puzzles, fortune telling in the form of a slot machine, trivia quizzes, and coloring pages, which can be printed into stickers.

name: Lupiton's Wonder Palette
description: Lupiton no Wonder Palette is a Kid Pix-esque paint suite game for the Casio Loopy. Creations can be printed with the Loopy's built-in sticker printer.

name: Little Romance
description: Little Romance is a game that allows players to create their own manga. Each comic panel can be designed in the software and then printed on the Loopy's built-in sticker printer. It was developed and published by Casio, and released in Japan in 1996.

name: I Want a Room in Loopy Town!
description:
This game was a room decorating simulator with job minigames to pay for furniture.

It predates Animal Crossing by 5 years, and the game’s scenario writer was Kenji Terada, the scenario writer for Final Fantasy 1-3.

name: Harihari Seal Paradise
description: A sticker-designing game for the Casio Loopy. Players can paint and stamp unique creations to print on the Loopy's built-in sticker printer.

name: Dream Change: Kogane-chan's Fashion Party
description: Sin descripción

name: Bow-wow Puppy Love Story
description:
It's Momo's birthday today, and her parents have a surprise for her: a puppy! She names her new friend Baku, and they two of them rush off to play at the park. While they're playing fetch, Baku finds a curious doll, which springs to life and tells her that the Kingdom of Memories is in trouble: the vegetables are revolting, and she's the only one who can stop them! The doll, Judy, and an alarm clock named Clock lead Momo and Baku there, and so their adventure begins.

Bow-wow Puppy Love Story is a simple Japanese-style adventure game designed for young girls. The majority of the game consists of written dialogue with cute animated characters. There are dialogue choices every so often, though they have only a minimal impact on the story progression. The player can also jump back to specific scenes, and print a variety of stickers with images from the game.

name: Cardcaptor Sakura: Tomoyo no Video Daisakusen
description: Step into Tomoyo's shoes and film Sakura in this anime adaption for Dreamcast.

name: Yumimi Mix
description: Yumimi Mix is an interactive novel for the Sega Mega CD platform. An enhanced remake for the Sega Saturn was also released, called Yumimi Mix Remix.

name: Zombie Attack 2: Second Wave
description: 2nd game in IUGO's Zombie Attack franchise

name: Trick Trap 1771
description: Trick Trap is an arcade game where you control a futuristic knight, armed with a variety of weapons. You must save the princess of Vegetaria!

name: Tiny Tim's Tremendous Tank
description: Tiny Tim and his Tremendous Tank is an awesome physics based action platform shooter that allows you to Destroy and Splatter anything that moves.

name: Aah Impossible Rescue
description: A sad kitten is a sad enough sight, but there's nothing sadder than a sad and wet kitten. YOU are armed with an uncanny ability to steer three stranded river kittens from afar. Will they be purring bundles of happiness, or scrawny damp fuzz-monsters? Its up to you in this "arcade kitten rescue mission simulator"

name: The Deep Cave
description: The Deep Cave is a side-scrolling platformer. The game stars Pi, a young boy who decides to explore a cave. Throughout the game, Pi will occasionally discuss various aspects of the cave with the player. There are multiple endings in The Deep Cave, depending on how many deaths the player accumulates throughout a single playthrough of the game.

name: RunMan: Race Around the World
description:
You may know RunMan from his appearance as a playable character in Super Meat Boy. Or you are a true indie gaming hipster and know him from even earlier.

An epic collaboration between Tom Sennett (Deepak Fights Robots) and Maddy Thorson (TowerFall, Celeste), RunMan: Race Around the World is a platformer with an emphasis on speed and flow.

To get a good score on each course, you have to run through it really fast without stopping. The actual scoring is a bit more complex than that, but that's basically it.

You can't die, because dying's not fun.

name: Project Blackout
description: A free-to-play first-person shooter for the PC.

name: Phineas and Ferb Ride Again
description: Phineas and Ferb Ride Again for the Nintendo DS was released on September 14, 2010.

name: Saigo no Yakusoku no Monogatari
description: Sin descripción

name: Conquest: Divide and Conquer
description: An indie games

name: Love Love Paradise
description: Eroge game developed by Nexton in 1996.

name: Super Taxi Driver
description: Super Taxi Driver is a racing game where the player acts as a taxi driver, delivering customers to their destinations as quickly as possible, released in 2000. It is a clone of Crazy Taxi.

name: U Want Cookie?
description: An Xbox Live Indie game

name: Trials Legends
description: Revisit the history of Trials in Trials Legends, a new, free PC game that recaptures the classic gameplay of the original web and PC-based Trials experience from 2000 to 2005.

name: Makenshi Kumiko
description: Eroge adventure game developed by New System House Oh! in 1988.

name: Datenshi Kyouko
description: Eroge adventure game developed by New System House Oh! in 1988.

name: Bishoujo Noriko
description: Eroge adventure game developed by New System House Oh! in 1988.

name: Mickey's Runaway Zoo
description: Educational game for kids.

name: Ponjalla no Houkago: Sadoubu(re) Hen
description: Eroge card game developed by NenGollo Software in 1995.

name: Daitanfuteki: Lucky Travel
description: Eroge game developed by Nekomimi Soft in 1993.

name: Schwarzschild GXR: Toki Gen no Ken Nin
description: Strategy game developed by Kogado in 1998.

name: Pixy Garden: Yousei Densetsu
description: Simulation game developed by NEC Interchannel in 1995.

name: Wiwi's Adventures 2
description: An Xbox Live indie game

name: Mercurius Pretty: End of the Century
description: A remake of the PC-98 life simulation "Mercurius Pretty" for the Sega Dreamcast. The main subject is to raise a fairy!.

name: Chi Eri Exciting Journey
description: Chi Eri Exciting Journey is an indie video game.

name: Sengoku Musou 3: Moushouden
description: Sin descripción

name: Irekae Maho-chan
description: Irekae Maho-chan is a puzzle platform game where the player controls the young girl Maho-chan, who has the curious ability to swap places with other creatures. She does this by throwing rainbow stars at them, and must use this ability to pass through walls in order to reach the exit door of each stage. Green walls can be shot through, while purple walls are solid and will block Maho-chan's exchange stars. There are a total of 50 stages, most of which have a very strict time limit, but the player can choose any stage to start or continue from.

name: Alawishus Pixel
description: A puzzle platformer for Xbox Live Indie games, where the goal is to reach the door in each level.

name: Ninja Escape
description: An Xbox Live Indie Game

name: Tanjou S: Debut
description: Tanjou S: Debut is a simulation game published by NEC Interchannel for the Sega Saturn. It is based upon the 1994 two-episode anime Tanjou: Debut.

name: Tanjou: Debut Pure
description: Strategy game published by SharRock in 1996.

name: Signatory: Chouinsha
description: Adventure game developed by NCS in 1991.

name: Lightning Bacchus: The Knight of Iron
description: Strategy game developed by NCS in 1989.

name: The Tempura of the Dead
description: A retro side-scrolling action platformer, focused around juggling zombie heads and activating Tempura Fever.

name: Blue Submarine No. 6: Time and Tide
description: Blue Submarine No. 6: Time And Tide is an underwater-exploration game developed by Sega and released for the Dreamcast in 2000. The game follows the exploits of a deep-sea salvage crew as they recover treasure. The game includes FMV animation by Gonzo, a renowned Anime studio responsible for the original OVA.

name: Pentium 2: Little Goddess
description: An adult strategy game created by Nampurrow in 1993.

name: Kagayake! Kira-kira Senshi Risky Jewel
description: An adventure game created by Natsume in 1994.

name: Dragon Master Silk
description:
A less racy remake of the original Dragon Master Silk for the Sega Saturn.
The size of the dungeons are considerably wider than the original, and the erotic contents are slightly modified for Sega Saturn.

name: Dragon Master Silk II
description: Dragon Master Silk II is an erotic RPG dungeon crawling game. This is the official sequel to "Dragon Master Silk: Ryuu Shoukan Musume Episode II" released on PC-98.

name: Dragon Master Silk: Ryuu Shoukan Musume Episode II
description: Dragon Master Silk: Ryuu Shoukan Musume Episode II is an erotic RPG dungeon crawling game. The subtitle says "Episode 2," but there is no "Episode 1" in this series. This game is the first original in the series.

name: Colony Odyssey
description: An adventure game originally developed by NEC for the PC-6001.

name: Cloth Out
description: An adult RPG developed by Nampurrow in 1993.

name: Reflec Beat
description: REFLEC BEAT is Konami's new touchscreen rhythm game that focuses on versus multiplayer gameplay using a mix of classic pong with the timing based tapping widely used in the bemani series.

name: Wet 2
description: Sequel to the 2009 grindhouse action game. Currently, no specific details about this title have been released.

name: Dragon Age Legends
description: The second Dragon Age flash game developed by EA2D. Was playable on Facebook and Google+ and was the first multi-player game for the Dragon Age franchise. Exists now as a free single-player download.

name: Tribal Trouble 2
description: Tribal Trouble 2 is the sequel to Tribal Trouble. Players are set in the shoes of a tribal captain, and they have to battle other players in this real-time strategy game.

name: Coin Dozer: Halloween
description: The Halloween version of the popular iPhone game.

name: The Super Dimension Fortress Macross II
description: Macross II is a horizontally-scrolling shooter based on the OVA of the same name.

name: You Are the Castle
description: An Xbox Live Indie Game

name: Kaiten Patissier
description: A puzzle game for the Xbox Live Marketplace.

name: Prismatic Solid
description:
Experience the abstract yet dangerous world of Prismatic Solid through its simple shapes and geometric aesthetic. Swim through a torrent of bullets in this stylish top down vertical shooter as you dodge flashing lasers, debris from explosions, and fluttering embers.

A wide array of weapons and unlockable upgrades are at your disposal, with many drastically altering the structure of your artillery. Featuring music by master game music composers Shinji Hosoe and Ayako Saso.

name: Green Island
description: A puzzle game for Xbox Live Indie Games

name: Cubelands
description: Cubelands is a spin-off of the popular indie game, Minecraft, and is based around the same system. You have a bunch of blocks and you have to build stuff with them.

name: Evil Dead: The Game
description: The game loosely follows the plot of the 1981 film The Evil Dead. You play as Ash Williams as he fights for his life against hoards of Deadites in both the Cabin itself and the woods surrounding it. Over the course of 30 levels, Ash can use the Chainsaw, Boomstick, and an axe to fight through the Deadites and save his friends.

name: Zeebo Sports Queimada
description: Zeebo Sports Queimada is a dodgeball game using Zeebo's accelerometer controller called Boomerang. The goal is to swing the Boomerang to throw the ball and dodge while other characters move around the court. The game features also an online ranking on Zeebo-net in which players can compare their achievements.

name: Action Hero 3D: Wild Dog
description: Action Hero 3D: Wild Dog is a beat 'em up game made for mobile devices and the Zeebo. It features 206 stages with 26 bosses challenging you with lethal combo punches and kicks along with its items.

name: Seaglass
description: Seaglass is a Tetris Attack-like game for iPhone, iPad and OsX devices released in 2009.

name: Sakusaku Daigoutou Returns
description: a hentai-themed action game played from a top-down perspective.

name: Parky and the Yellow Submarine
description: A 3rd-person perspective action platformer developed for C64.

name: The Incident
description: Something is causing dozens of variously household and obscure items to start falling from the sky. It is your job to jump and climb to the zenith of this pile to discover just what the heck is going on.

name: Paper Ninja
description:
Who says paper cuts can’t kill?

Each ball of paper bouncing up to you will unravel a swift and deadly ninja waiting to slice you up.

Swipe your finger across the screen to slash the paper ninjas before they get to you!

name: Arctopia
description: Arctopia is a puzzle game for the iPhone. The goal is to eliminate flames with blocks of ice or metal.

name: Emergency 2012: The Quest for Peace
description: Micromanage various emergency response units in this fifth installment of the Emergency series of games. Developed by Quadriga Games. Published by Deep Silver.

name: Dr. Mazing
description: Help Dr. Mazing save the planet by battling ruthless robots and cold-blooded, merciless aliens in this epic journey to stop evil Lord Gazal Nim from taking over the planet.

name: Pocket Frogs
description: Pocket Frogs is a frog breeding game for the iPhone.

name: Suzumiya Haruhi no Tsuisou
description: Suzumiya Haruhi no Tsuisou is a “wandering adventure” game for the PlayStation 3 and PlayStation Portable, published by Namco Bandai Games. It was released as a tie-in to The Disappearance of Haruhi Suzumiya film, taking place shortly afterward in the parallel universe.

name: The 4th Unit 7 - Wyatt
description: The 7th entry in the 4th Unit series.

name: The 4th Unit 6 - MerryGoRound
description: The sixth entry in the 4th Unit series.

name: The 4th Unit 4 - Zero
description:
Zero is the fourth 4th Unit game.

Only a few days have passed since the andoird assaults and the shocking encounter with Blon-Win's clone. The Unified Force gathers all its resources, preparing to engage the shady trade organization WWWF. However, a strange accident leads Blon-Win to assume that one of the Unified Force's members might be a traitor.

name: The 4th Unit 5 - D-Again
description:
D-Again is the fifth 4th Unit game.

The criminal trade organization WWWF was finally defeated. The bionic soldier Blon-Win is appointed a high-ranked inspector and sent on a mission to protect the secret service agent Remi Binderk on the way to the United Nations conference in Geneva. On board the TGV train in France Blon-Win encounters her old acquaintance Dalzy, who tells her that former WWWF members have united to form the Einheit group, and are working on a new dangerous weapon known as G-R.

name: Balance of Power: 21st Century
description: Sequel to Chris Crawford's highly influential Cold War simulation. This time the game tackles modern conflicts in Asia and the Middle-East.

name: Psychic Detective Final: Solitude Part 2
description: The 2nd part of the final entry of the Psychic Detective series.

name: Psychic Dectetive Final: Solitude Part 1
description: The 1st part of the final entry of Data West's game series.

name: Psychic Detective Vol. 4: Orgel
description: The 4th entry in the franchise and the 2nd title to be released on a console.

name: Psychic Detective Vol. 5: Nightmare
description: The 5th entry in the Data West adventure series.

name: Psychic Detective Vol. 2: Memories
description: The 2nd entry in Data West's FM Town adventure series.

name: Psychic Detective Vol. 3: Aya
description: The 3rd entry in the Psychic Detective franchise and the first title to be released on a console.

name: Formula One Arcade
description: Do you like F1 cars but hate realism? Then this is the Formula One game for you.

name: Psychic Detective Vol. 1: Invitation
description: The first entry in Data West's Popular adventure game series.

name: Rescue Heroes: Hurricane Havoc
description: A Fisher-Price based educational game.

name: Math Blaster Mystery: Pre-Algebra
description:
A point-and-click adventure set in a spooky mansion and focusing on building key mathematics skills.

This is a re-make of Math Blaster Mystery: The Great Brain Robbery.
Re-released as Math Blaster for 5th Grade in 1999

name: Charly the Clown
description: Platform game starring the clown Charly.

name: The Hardy Boys: The Perfect Crime
description: A series of malicious crimes grips the Hardy Boys' hometown of Bayport and it's up to Frank and Joe Hardy to assist the police in their attempt to capture the culprits. From the first crime scene, however, it becomes apparent that there's an even deeper plot to these sinister activities.

name: Harley-Davidson: Race to the Rally
description: Motorcycle racing game

name: Carl Lewis Athletics 2000
description: A track and field game for the Game Boy Color based around the Decathlon. It was only released in Europe.

name: The Muppet CD-ROM: Muppets Inside
description: The Muppets are trapped inside your computer and it's your job to rescue them! Dive into The Muppet CD-ROM: Muppets Inside, a hilarious "misadventure" that combines challenging gameplay with witty, offbeat Muppet humor. Your goal is to round up the Muppets and along the way you'll encounter seven Muppetized games: help the Swedish Chef battle vicious vegetables in "Kitchens of Doom," but don't get lost in the Carpal Tunnel! Multiple skill levels guarantee fun for everyone, from novices to experienced gamers. With Muppets Inside you'll meet the latest members of the Muppet crew and discover over an hour of new audio and video footage, plus five new songs and classic clips from The Muppet Show.

name: Another Century's Episode Portable
description: Sin descripción

name: Snoopy: The Cool Computer Game
description: Snoopy: The Cool Computer Game was developed and published by The Edge / Edge Games. Designed for younger players, who control Snoopy and solve puzzles.

name: Devastating Blow
description: Devastating Blow, the first game from Beyond Belief, is a two-dimensional boxing game. An up-and-coming boxer must fight his way up to the top, eventually facing Mike Tyson himself.

name: Vampire Rage
description: A vertical scrolling shooter for Xbox Live Indie Games.

name: Where in the USA is Carmen Sandiego? (Enhanced)
description: Enhanced version of the original game "Where in the USA is Carmen Sandiego?".

name: Spider-Man: Total Mayhem
description: Platformer featuring the Ultimate Spider-Man, taking place in the Ultimate Marvel Universe (Earth-1610).

name: Eternal Damnation
description: This mod is part of the POSTAL Fudge Pack. It features the undead, demons and more plot twists than you can shake a stick at.

name: Pyramid Adventures: Episode 1 - Treasures of the Lost Pyramid
description: The first and only game in the Pyramid Adventures series. The sequel never materialized.

name: Intrigue At Oakhaven Plantation
description: A point and click adventure game that takes place at Oakhaven, a 19th century plantation in Louisiana.

name: Durarara!! 3-way Standoff
description: In this one-player only game, you play as Yoshimune Miyoshi, a student who transfers to the same school as Kida Masaomi, Ryugamine Mikado and Sonohara Anri. You get to talk to the characters and explore Ikebukuro where the DRRR!! story is set and learn about the gangs, Dollars, Yellow Scarves and a rumoured headless rider who haunts the streets on a motorbike.

name: Jurassic Park: Survival
description: Planned to coincide with Jurassic Park 3, Survival was to see players take on dinosaurs and terrorists alike as they fought to escape Isla Sorna. The game, however, quickly went extinct.

name: Target Toss Pro: Lawn Darts
description: Be Careful! You'll Kill Your Little Brother with Those Things!

name: Epiphany in Spaaace!
description: Epiphany in Spaaace! is scifi parody text adventure game for XBLA Indie game.

name: Ankh: The Tales of Mystery
description:
Ankh: The Tales of Mystery is a 3D point-and-click adventure game set in Cairo, Egypt, 500 BC. The player controls the boy Domi Rhadjif who is tasked by his father to help him out with a number of errands, even though there are a number of terrorists outside his house, anachronistically armed with automatic guns. Eventually, Domi has to rescue a princess, deal with the god Osiris, and get rid of the Lybian terrorists. Despite the Egyptian setting, there are numerous modern elements and items used for comical effect.

The game uses a classic point-and-click interface. The mouse is used to move around and actions (Use, Look, Pick up, Talk, Give, and Open) can be selected at the bottom of the screen. Domi can pick up various items and store them in an inventory, shown in the bottom right of the screen. It is possible to talk to NPCs and select from multiple dialogue options.

name: Supernaturals
description: An uncompleted video game for the Gizmondo handheld console, a GPS-enhanced turn-based strategy RPG based around a clandestine Victorian-era monster-hunter group.

name: Create Your Own Caricature with Spitting Image
description: A CD-i Title that allowed you to make caricatures of celebrities and your own photos.

name: Dead of the Brain 2
description: The sequel to Dead of the Brain, from Japanese developer Fairytale. Time has passed, but are the zombie dead really gone?

name: Urban Space Squirrels
description: Urban Space Squirrels is a Xbox 360 indie game. A super powered squirrel is controlled in a platform/puzzle environment.

name: Dragon Ball GT: Transformation 2
description: The unreleased sequel to Dragon Ball GT: Transformation

name: Petz Fantasy: Moonlight Magic
description: Cutesy fantasy creatures to play with.

name: CarJacker: Hotwired and Gone!
description:
Game takes inspiration from 'Gone in 60 seconds' movie, and gameplay wise is similar to a mix of Driver and Grand Theft Auto games.

The game offers a free-roaming environment in a single city with different buildings and locations, traffic and pedestrians. During the missions the scope is limited because all missions have a time limit. Only the final bonus mission, where the player is awarded luxury cars, can be played without any restrictions. The player can move around on foot or in cars that can be stolen. The game is controlled from a third-person perspective with an optional inside view while driving a car. Movement is done through the keyboard while the mouse is used to steer, zoom and rotate the camera.

By performing missions or beating up people the player earns cash. This can be used to repair a car or get gas as all cars only have a limited supply. This is shown in the bottom right corner of the screen while the bottom left corner shows a mini-map of the city to view gas stations, targets or police cars when a tracker has been installed. In the different missions the player will need to steal cars, install trackers on police cars, race another character, kill an entire opposing gang or escort the boss. While moving around on foot, the protagonist can beat up other character or use any of the three available weapons: a pistol, a uzi gun or a wrench. The wrench can also be used to remove the wheels from stationary cars to immobilize them.

name: Shadowbane: Throne of Oblivion
description: Throne of Oblivion was the Second of two expansion packs to be added to Shadowbane. It introduced the game to the Vampire race, Nightstalker & Necromancer classes, and four siege specialist disciplines.

name: Terra Militaris
description: A free to play MMORTS constructed from Flash scheduled for European release.

name: ReBounce
description: ReBounce is an iOS game similar to Peggle. Where it differs is that you control the ball after the initial shot and you only do not have multiple shots.

name: Space Phallus
description: Space Phallus is an side scrolling indie space shooter, developed by Charlie's Games in 2009 where you battle waves of genitalia and various body fluids. The graphic style and music is influenced by the Commodore 64 era, and the game features music by John Marwin, Magnus Pálsson, David Harris and Roald Strauss.

name: Fancy Nancy: Tea Party Time!
description: You are cordially invited to celebrate with Fancy Nancy at the most fantastic tea party in the neighborhood hosted by the fabulous Mrs. DeVine.

name: SD Gundam G Generation Touch
description: G Generation Touch is the first G Gen game for the iPhone, and is also the first game in the series to feature Gundam Unicorn.

name: AKB1/48: Idol to Koishitara
description: AKB1/48: Idol to Koishitara is a dating sim based on the AKB48 idol group.

name: Decimation X
description: A shooter akin to Space Invaders from Xona Games, a Nova Scotia based XNA developer.

name: Jessica's Cupcake Cafe
description: Help Jessica transform her aunt's failing old bakery into a complete success. Get Jessica's Cupcake Cafe up and running by attracting plenty of customers with delicious recipes and a hip atmosphere. Use your Time Management skills to earn as much money as you can, open up brand new shops, offer more tasty items, and upgrade your equipment. Keep the candy-coated cupcakes coming to please your clientele!

name: Star Crisis
description: A side-scrolling retro shooter from Excalibur Games, and featuring music from Magnus Palsson, the composer behind VVVVVV.

name: Zombie Estate
description: Fend off hordes of zombies in this retro-styled multiplayer game.

name: Undercover: Dual Motives
description: Undercover: Dual Motives is a prequel to the PC game Wintersun, in which players relive the early days of physicist and reluctant spy Dr. John Russell.

name: DragonRealms
description: DragonRealms is a fantasy MUD created by Simutronics in 1996. It has fallen in popularity with the rise of graphical MMOs, but is still one of the most popular MUDs today.

name: Nogginknockers
description: A gory variation of Pong from Bloodlust Software.

name: Ninja Pac Man
description: A standard Pac-Man game, but isometric and with a ninja theme.

name: Spider-Man: The Sinister Six
description: Spider-Man: The Sinister Six was a PC CD-Rom title from the mid-90's which was similar to many Lucas Arts adventure games.

name: Tenchi Muyo! Toko Muyo
description: Tenchi Muyo! Toko Muyo is a visual novel style game made for the PSX. It features a variety of characters from the series placed into a High School setting.

name: Blocks Mania
description: A puzzle game in which you launch a block into various objects such as crates and speed ramps in an attempt to reach a star.

name: Pig Out: Dine Like A Swine
description: Help Oscar, Starr, and Buster the pigs escape the butcher. Run amok in the city eating everything you can!

name: Agent MOO: Maximum Overdeath
description: This is a a 2D deathmatch game for up to 16 players featuring vehicles, portals, and weapons such rocket launchers and a sack of oranges. Features an original soundtrack by I KILL PXLS.

name: Harrys Restaurant
description: magnussoft

name: Platformance: Castle Pain
description: A retro platformer from Magiko Gaming centered around speed runs of a single stage.

name: Ultraman Nexus
description: Ultraman Nexus is a Playstation 2 fighting game based on the japenese television series of the same name.

name: My Exotic Farm
description: Get exotic with parrots and stuff on your very own DSiWare farm.

name: Monster Slider
description: The game is a competitive falling block puzzle game similar to Puyo Puyo. Pairs of differently colored blocks fall into a well. The player must arrange them so that three identically colored blocks are touching in order to eliminate them. The floor of the well is staggered such that a block can be touching two other blocks on each side (in addition to a block above and a block below). Additionally, the floor is tilted at an angle. Blocks are affected by gravity and slide off of each other in the direction of the tilt after they are placed. The player can change the tilt of the floor at any time, which causes the blocks to shift around. A block also falls when placed over an empty space or when the block below it is eliminated. Players can use the effect of gravity to create chain reactions where one set of eliminated blocks causes another set to be eliminated, and the ability to change the tilt of the floor can be used to induce reactions by shifting falling blocks before they land.

name: Psy-Phi
description: Psy-Phi is a 2005 touch-screen-based arcade fighting game developed by Digital Rex, a Sega studio led by Yu Suzuki. It was the first full-screen HD title to utilize strictly touch-screen controls. However, the game was pulled and never saw a wide release beyond location tests.

name: Psycho Santa
description: Freebie game included on a demo disk in the January 1993 issue of "The One" Amiga magazine.

name: Quagmire
description: Released for the Macintosh in 1993, Quagmire is a puzzle platformer developed by shareware author, Tony Small. The gameplay involves typical platforming combined with firing at enemies with a bullet that follows a varying trajectory based on your mouse position.

name: Space Station 13
description: Space Station 13 (ss13) is a multiplayer role-playing game. Originally created by one person named Exadv1, development has been continued by members of the fan base.

name: Hellion: Mystery of the Inquisition
description: Hellion: Mystery of the Inquisition is a first person shoot set in the 13th century.
